CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 15, 1961, pg. B19, reads: "RED-HOT SMITH ALL-STARS - This team of Tommy Smith All-Stars was going nowhere, until Fifth Ward Constable Thomas J. Smith, their sponsor, took charge, following the recent election. Since that time, the team has won 12 games in a row.  Encouraged to believe they can win the championship of the Ammon Slow Pitch Softball League, the players are, left to right, first row: N. Coney, P. Matthew, Leroy Lowery, R. Lewis, M. Terry and E. Terry.  Second row: H. Davis, W. Austin, H. Holt, J. Younger, J. Smith, W. Connors (bat boy), B. Johnson, T. Watkins, R. Reid, C. Pope, C. Lewis, R. Jackson and Constable Smith. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Tommy Smith softball team, kneeling from left: N. Coney, P. Matthew, Leroy Lowrey, R. Lewis, M. Terry, E. Terry; standing: H. Davis, W. Austin, Harry Holt, Jackie Younger, J. Smith, B. Johnson, Tom Watkins, R. Reid, C. Pope, C. Lewis, R. Jackson, sponsor Thomas J. "Tommy" Smith, and batboy Wesley Connors holding glove in center, posed on Ammon Field
